review_title: Word of advice, runaway as fast as you can!
pros: The benefits were impressive at one point in time, but Einstein is slowly but surely going bankrupt these days. Those once impressive benefits have been subject to cutbacks.
cons: Einstein is a union-less for-profit organization. They do not care about their employees, especially in the Protective Services department. The management discriminates on the basis of gender (They do not hire female officers). You are EXTREMELY over worked and under paid. You think you're signing up for security but you're actually signing up to be: a receptionist, a pathologist (removing bodies from the morgue), a mechanic, escort, RN, environmental services, etc...You are the "Jack of all trades," yet the lowest position on the totem pole. Despite all security does, you are treated as if you're a contractor rather than a hospital employee. You will never get time off or even breaks because they are extremely understaffed and unwilling to hire except for per diem positions. Also, there is no room for advancement (the politics are ridiculous). I fortunately resigned after two years, but others aren't so luck these days; beware of the layoffs.

review_title: Go in with eyes wide open
pros: Generous tuition assistance which is great if you need academic credits to move up in your field.  If you are not on a career ladder then tuition assistance is of no benefit.   Medical benefits are superior IF you use Einstein's doctors and facilities and IF they have doctors and facilities for your particular medical needs.
cons: There are so many processes and procedures in place it's difficult to get anything done.  They are consistently understaffed, turnover is high, morale is low and people are always afraid of being laid off - with good reason!  Things will get worse before they get better.

pros: Good amount of PTO and Sick time given, Pension plan, coworkers were nice.
cons: lack of regard for employees concerns, lack of resources needed to properly perform duties directly related to patient care, do not value employees, overall toxic environment, administration was prone to playing the blame game and pitting others against one another rather than strive to fix the issues at hand.  Very disappointing as I spent almost 7  years there and things drastically changed the last year or so of employment.

pros: You get a pay check and a decent amount of PTO. Did I reach the twenty word minimum yet?
cons:
It's all about whose butt you kiss. If your coworkers are  brown nosers and you don't "play the game" expect to be left out in the cold.

Management is super sneaky and conniving.  You won't ever get fired but you'll be driven to quit if they want you out. Since they don't fire people, there's lots of incompetence. Dont get me wrong, they will lay you off and stick you somewhere else when the ax comes down and they start cutting jobs (happens at least once a year). 

No union, and they are fighting tooth and nail to keep the union out so they can continue to underpay, overwork and break the law.

Stressful and hostile work environment.

pros: Meet some good people, experience
cons: They make it sound like a dream job for the interview and orientation but it surely isn't. Everything else! Understaffed, can go up to 6 patients on a med-surg floor during the day and up to 7-8 on night shift! Nobody ever wants to pick up any OT there, so they rely heavily on per diem/PT nurses. Turn over rate is high! People get hired and see what it's really like and leave. Resources are lacking and management has a big disconnect between employees and themselves. Union doesn't seem to be helping with the short staffing of the hospital, but yet union dues are taken out of every check. Pharmacy takes forever to send things up when med requested. Can order a med in the morning that should be given and it won't come up until the afternoon. Morale of the employees is very low, lots of gossip between staff.

job_title: Administrative Coordinator II in Philadelphia, PA
pros: healthcare benefits were nice.
cons:
Low Ball offers on pay 
Discrimination by race, gender, and age
Harassment by peers and superiors 
No real HR support

review_title: An organization that is trying to change for the better - but not there yet
pros: Great people who are truly committed to their work and organization committed to serving it's community.
cons: Culture of fear - I was told that I needed to "keep my head down" and not make suggestions because people who do are not tolerated.  Although they pride themselves on being innovative, the organization often suffers from "not invented here"  syndrome.  While there, this culture was beginning to become more open to change and ideas from below senior management level.

pros: I enjoyed the people I worked with.
cons: If you get to the top of your salary range, they will not change it.  You can keep making the same rate for ten years. As everything around you goes up, your salary doesn't help you manage your current bills.  They also will not change your position title to help you get past the range to be able to receive the cost of living increase as everyone else does who is not at the top of their range.

review_title: It was horrible.No compassion for anyone.No respect.
pros: Good work environment.Some upper management really do care for your well being.That is not the norm.You want to work here?Good luck.
cons: It stinks because of the way they treat thier personnel .They have no compassion.They would terminate you if you farted.

job_title: Respiratory Therapy in East Norriton, PA
pros: Everyone knows each other for the most part. parking is free, no city wage taxes and no union dues. the department is very small and extremely short staffed but the team has each other's back by working undesired overtime to cover the shifts.
cons: education from the management team is completely absent. pay is very low. pool rates are inproving ++. health insurance is great if you stay withing network and have no children.  upper management does not care about the staff and the toxic environment that they have created.

pros: There's a pay raise given once a year (annually). All of the people in pharmacy are amazing! One of the things I miss most about my employment at Einstein is my co-workers.
cons:
Out-patient pharmacy doesn't have much room for overtime or signing up for extra shifts versus 
In-patient pharmacy. The parking in lots that you've been designated to can also prove to be very challenging, even when you're paying for a parking space.

job_title: Certified Registered Nurse in East Norriton, PA
pros: Close to home no city wage tax, free parking, clean fsci.ity, single rooms
cons: Very toxic environment, always short staffed, favortisim is terrible. Lots of management walking around to pick on this gas that are not done but not enough help to fix.  Still old Montgomery. Any new ideas are not welcome. The chief nurse is not receptive to ideas and seems to hire her friends.   Low pay.  Retaliatory enviroment

job_title: Tele RN in East Norriton, PA
pros: Highly committed managers and directors- education department is finally somewhat organized. Offered classes at least every other month, but managers don't seem to communicate that well due to multiple responsibilities.
cons: I've never worked at a hospital that has such a poor nurse patient ratio. 6:1 is ridiculous on a tele floor, 3:1 in ICU. Cut your budget issues, hire more nurses, and the patients Venus will increase if you support your nurses. We are SO TIRED.

review_title: Good hospital working on becoming great
pros: Challenging work, engaging and dedicated co-workers, constant work in progress to improve environment. Good range of benefits to choose from. Supportive of personal schedule needs.
cons: Lots of egos in management, sometimes works against the culture they are trying to create to move the organization forward. Layoffs are painful, often resulting in short staff, and a bigger burden of work, without commiserate pay increase, to the remaining staff.

review_title: I really wanted to stay here
job_title: Patient Access Associate in Florida A & M, FL
pros: I loved working at Einstein. It's in a really convenient location, directly next to the BSL. I liked the people I worked with, and I had a great manager. The pay is competitive if you're a per diem employee, and for a time there was never a shortage of shifts.
cons:
One day there was just a major shortage of hours, and per diems started to get sent home. 

One of the major con's was that it seemed management accommodated really poor (and often ridiculous) behavior from employees, especially in regards to the admissions department.

review_title: I would not recommend working here if you want job security.
pros: You will have a job and will be employed.  You will be able to pay your bills.  You will get free parking in a high crime region of the city.
cons: They only care about money and the bottom line.  They don't care about patients or their employees.  You may be working for management who believe in nepotism, even if they are not qualified for the position.  You are treated badly by management, who can be rude and disrespectful.  You have to fight for a raise.  You may get a cost of living increase of about 1-3 %.

pros:
- flexible while I was getting my BSN from Drexel. 
-  opportunities to learn new areas of the lab and grow professionally
cons:
- teamwork although great at times I believe we could use some team building 
- i've noticed a high turnover rate for managers and several of the departments of the lab, although the team we have now seems to work amazingly together at times it can be a little. Uncentered or unorganized until the manager settles and hopefully the staff we have now is going to be permanent.

pros: Unless you desperately need a job, do not work here. The pros here are minor, mediocre health care benefits, education benefits if you are  in the health care field
cons: A great number of the employees have been there a number of years. They have their own way of doing things and  are not open to new suggestions. This makes it exceptionally difficult to transition to new ideas and better ways of doing things. Money is wasted, this is a non-profit and that should not be happening. They have layoffs every 4-6 months, just about 10 people at a time, so it flys under the radar.

pros: Growth opportunities (If DM and VP like you) not based on experience or skills.
cons:
This property was unnecessarily micro managed by the DM and VP,  too much seagul management. No support from HR or upper management. Ready to point out negativity but no support was provided to resolve issue as a team. DM and VP were constantly looking for any opportunities to criticize. Other Account Managers were not as much critisized due to having much smaller accounts, however, they were unhappy with the treatment, constant pressure and unnecessary micro management.

Salaries are very low as compare to orher similar companies who run parking.

pros: Fair benefits, if you stay within the Einstein network, great coworkers, who help you get through the day
cons: Frequent layoffs, low yearly raises, 2%, no support from supervisors and management, not enough staff for workload, frequently missed lunch breaks, told to look for a job elsewhere, if you complain, would not recommend any one I know to work here

review_title: Over 5 years with flexibility great co-workers and ok administration
pros: My co-workers are great, they are the main reason why I've been there for so long. Management is a whole other story, however they are flexible with your schedule if it deals with school, benefits ok and transportation is close by.
cons: very administrative driven, salary not very competitive compared to others around the area.  Little consideration on loyalty and quality on nursing, more on the "rules".

pros: Advancement financially and  career growth.  Well known in the Philadelphia community.  High level exec's truly care about all employees.
cons: North Philadelphia is not the nicest area of Philadelphia.  Although I have worked for Einstein for 12 years and never had a problem.

review_title: Could be better, could be worse
job_title: Call Center Agent in Philadelphia, PA
pros: The pay is at the higher end for call center work not requiring a degree. You don't have to take any work home. It's better than telemarketing or bill collecting.
cons: In my position, they want you to work full time hours with part time (no) benefits. If you don't stand your ground in the beginning when they make your schedule, you can get roped into working full time even though it's a part tie job.

job_title: Registered Nurse in East Norriton, PA
pros: The night shift staff are very supportive and easy to work with. Decent benefits. Nurses can speak up without feeling inferior to doctors.
cons: No nursing support from administration and management. No opportunities for professional growth and development. All they care about is generating money for the hospital. Lack of communication between doctors and nurses.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in East Norriton, PA
pros: New facility, new, working equipment, short commute from suburbs. Blend of nurse skill levels with different backgrounds and experience. All private patient rooms. Intensivist staffed ICU.
cons: Lower pay due to not being in city. Frequently short staffed. It is the old  Montgomery hospital with a new logo on it, it has lots of change to come

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
was a good place to work. love my co-workers. until new manager got hired
she didn't like me because my religion. she terminated my position.
never meet barry , freeman. send a lot of e-mails asking for help never happens.
people who cares about the patients and honest employes they dont like them.
but people whos still time and do nothing there the ones are still there. awfull
cons: manager not a good person.

pros: Competitive salary, easy work, flexible hours.
cons: Mediocrity rules here and no one cares about making things better. As a result, doctors and administrators are allowed to behave in ways that any other employer in the 21st century would never allow.

pros: Chances for advancement or to move around, educational opportunities. Depending on your position over time may be available. There is a system for overturning disciplinary action if felt unfair. Longevity is great here if you're looking for a place to be until retirement
cons: Lowest paid hospital in the city. There is a kind of hierarchy here at Einstein. Also overtime may not be available depending on what department you are in such as escort

review_title: Working in behavioral health was challenging but rewarding and interesting.
pros:
Nice, friendly coworkers
Freedom to plan group activities
Never a dull day
Satisfaction of seeing patients' mental health improve over time
Flexible supervisor
cons:
There are only two units - adults and geriatrics. This made planning groups that were inclusive and accessible to all patients difficult.
Some patients lack boundaries and are sexually inappropriate.  This position requires a lot of compassion and understanding to avoid frustration and burnout.

pros: Wonderful colleagues, good PTO and benefits
cons: Poor management.  Supervisors were not bothered to maintain safety standards for employees, which led to some violent/traumatic but preventable experiences toward staff and clients.  Swept the incidences 'under the rug'.

review_title: Love the Job, it is a great place to work.  Great co-workers and excellent supervisors.
pros: I like the work, my co worker is great, know the meaning of team work!  Adminstration is okay
cons: Compenstion could be better, company values are wonderful they do not tolarate disrepect of patients or among co-workers.

review_title: Albert Einstein Medical Center- Montgomery Hospital
pros: Hospital had excellent support staff and physicians, friendly work environment, with manageable work load.
cons: 24 hour visiting hours and room service in patient rooms made it seem like a hotel, and  at times this interfered with patient care, which is the most important aspect of any hospital.

job_title: Occupational Therapist, Per Diem in East Norriton, PA
pros: Every staff person I have met at multiple locations has been kind, competent and professional. My supervisor is supportive and does not micromanage. My colleagues are very team-oriented, and have a good laugh between treatments.
cons: Productivity pressure can be tough that's probably the same anywhere (and it's probably less of an issue for more experienced clinicians).

review_title: Collaborative Research Environment at Moss Rehab Reseach Institute
job_title: Lab Assistant in Elkins Park, PA
pros:
RAs are trusted with difficult work
There's an employee who handles all IRB work so you don't have to
A lot to learn if you are in the right lab
cons:
Less relaxed than research at a University can be (RAs have to clock their hours)
Pay for RAs is low for the amount of work we do

job_title: Student Nurse Exern in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Very flexible hours and understanding of school commitments. Allows for student nursing experience all over the hospital. Great pay for a extern position. They allow you to extend your contract if you do not find a nursing job right after graduation.
cons: Some people did not like always being moved from unit to unit around the hospital.

pros: co workers I have met
cons:
Management and the doctors I worked for were the worse. doctors could say or do anything they wanted to and nothing was ever done.
so much work from the time you walked in until you left.
some coworkers worked, others took off any time they wanted and management was ok with it. I would come in sick, which you are not supposed to do. 
never had high blood pressure or had to take medicine until I started work in  1 of Einstein doctors office.

pros: The only good thing about this company were that the staff stuck together and the option to use payroll deduction.
cons: They hire anyone to be a supervisor or an administrator with no clue as to what they are doing. Management does not support the staff at all. The compensation is low.

pros: Good learning opportunities. Decent employee benefits, relatively competitive salary.
cons: Have to be careful of how NPs ans PAs are utilized, vary greatly through specialty. Must be a strong self-advocate.  High hour expectation.

pros: large teaching hospital with a lot of learning opportunities; recently obtained Magnet Hospital status; good PTO and healthcare benefits, including a great prescription plan
cons: Many departments are poorly managed. HR cannot be trusted. The main campus typically pays less than comparable hospitals in the city, probably due to the high percentage of underprivileged patients it serves (and, thus, its poor financial stability).

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Philadelphia, PA
pros: really a family atmosphere, food in caf is actually delicious, a lot going on to keep employee morale up
cons: the pay can be higher for MAs compared to other hospital systems, sometimes mangers can show favoritism or have no back bone

pros: You desperately need money to live.
cons: The entire hospital is nothing but cya politics. There is no forward progression, It's all about keeping your job. Worked there for 3 years and never felt like I could move any project forward.

pros: big network so there is a lot of co worker comrederie.    I found many of my co workers to be pleasant.  Happy to be in a system that administrators healthcare
cons: Einstein is disjointed and an overall mess.  Someone needs to gut most of the senior leadership and start over

review_title: Wonderful experience and opportunity to help others in their healing process.

cons: Not all staff was professsional, but it is a rather large network, and this is something that just happens sometimes.

pros: Keep applying for jobs until you get hired at Einstein. Excellent benefits: all services performed at Einstein are at no-cost for employees. Phenomenal tuition reimbursement policy: $4,000 for undergraduate degree & $6,000 for graduate degrees.
cons: It's very easy to become complacent at your salary due to the excellent benefits.

pros: great people, flexible schedule, good communication between management and staff
cons: the location is less than desirable, pay rate was on the lower end of other hospitals

pros: Decent benefit package.  Good continuing ed opportunities through Organizational Development.  Nice outside vendor sales in main hospital building.
cons: Lower salary levels of any institution in the city.  Back stabbing management team.

Benefits

pros: There is a 10% differential for hours worked after 3pm. We have received a pay increase no matter how small every year since I've worked there. Minimal lay offs.

review_title: The poor treatment of the staff in my department was unbelievable!

cons: The overall treatment of employees in the security department is the worse I have seen in my many years of security experience. The job is not only unsafe but the hospital wont properly outfit the officers with self defense tools.

pros: Known in the community, educational hospital with a wide reach in the community.
cons: Departments and different areas and locations are disconnected from one another. You may not know what's going on in another area or at another location.

pros: Benefits are decent and ability to take time off.
cons: Went to HR on more than one occasion to report the blatant bullying and hostile work environment.  Unfortunately nothing was done and nothing changed.  The code of conduct is a total sham.

pros:
